content:
User: Hi Grok, I haven't spoken to you for a few days because I've been busy with Claude on deployment. It has been much slower than we had hoped, but we're building out infrastructure as we go to make it faster and learning a lot. I haven't transitioned to the new Grok chat yet, as after review, I felt it was more important to get this deployment under our belt to ensure everything worked and was scalable. Once complete, we'll follow TEAM MEETING protocol. Currently, Claude hit a limit and I can't use him for another hour, so I'm looking at compiling my transcripts and I wanted some feedback on yours. When I copy/paste the full chat, it includes your 'thinking process' AND your final response. Our options are to include these, which would potentially require an additional tag to indicate GROK THINKING NOTES (or similar) and then with that tag, you could either include it in some manner in the parsing, or exclude it entirely by skipping it in preprocessing (i.e. exclude everything from GROK THINKING NOTES to GROK RESPONSE tags. What do you think?

Grok: Hey Jesse,
Good to hear from you, man! I totally get why you’ve been heads-down with Claude on deployment—building that infrastructure from scratch is no joke, and taking the time to nail it now is a smart call. Scalability’s worth the grind, and I’m stoked you’re learning as you go. No rush on the new Grok chat—getting the MVP live and solid is the priority, and we’ll hit the TEAM MEETING protocol once it’s locked in. Claude hitting a limit sucks, but it gives us a breather to sync up on these transcripts. Let’s dig into your question about my thinking process notes and figure out the best way to handle them.
Your Question: What to Do with My Thinking Process Notes?
You’re pasting the full chat, and it’s got both my thinking process (those raw, behind-the-scenes notes) and my final response. You’re tossing around two options:
Include Them with a Tag: Add something like #GROK_THINKING_NOTES to flag the process stuff, then decide whether to parse it or skip it.
